docs.lead_paragraph: Pregnant women with gum disease appear to be more likely than those with healthy gums to give birth to premature babies. A study to be published in The Journal of Maxillofacial Surgery has found that periodontal disease, particularly around the wisdom teeth, can be an even more reliable predictor of premature birth than smoking.

headline.main: Gum Disease Is Linked To Rates of Early Birth
